Michigan Initial Health & Safety Training Module B
Section 1: Administration of Medications

What Can Child Care Programs Do?

Let’s discuss what child care programs can do to keep children safe from responses to food allergies.

  • Centers

    Within 90 days all child care staff and unsupervised volunteers that work with children must be trained.

    Under Center Rule R400.8131(5a) it states that “Within 90 days of being hired, or the 1st day as an unsupervised volunteer, all child care staff members and all unsupervised volunteers who work directly with children shall complete training on administration of medications.”

  • Homes

    Within 90 days licensee, child care staff members and child care assistants must be trained

    Under Rule R400.1905(4b) for Family and Group Homes it states that “Within 90 days after receiving a child care license or being hired at a child care home, a licensee, a child care staff member, and a child care assistant shall complete training on administration of medications.”

  • Not Meeting Requirement

    Not meeting this requirement is a common violation for homes 157 violations written in 2021

    Failure to follow this licensing requirement has resulted in several licensing violations. In 2021, 157 licensed family or group homes were issued violations for this.
